metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3572 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in python-pip in the way it handled Unicode separators in git references. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to install a different revision on a repository. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity. This is fixed in python-pip version 21.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> pip < 10, i.e. pip in bionic and older, parses git references differently, requiring a more significant backport

criterions.comment: python-pip package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm2').
